meanings.definition: A series of fine lines or fibers in the eyepiece of an optical instrument, used as a reference point or measuring scale.
meanings.sent1: The scientist adjusted the reticles in the microscope to measure the tiny organism.
meanings.sent2: When looking through the telescope, you can see the stars more clearly with the reticles in place.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat tried to catch the reticles moving inside the binoculars.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes followed the reticles like a detective tracing a suspect's path.
meanings.sent5: The reticles in the camera lens helped the photographer focus on the subject perfectly.

meanings.definition: A network of fine lines, wires, or the like placed in the focus of the eyepiece of an optical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The sniper adjusted the reticles in the scope before taking the shot.
meanings.sent2: The binoculars had clear reticles that made bird-watching easier.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended the reticles were spiderwebs in the telescope.
meanings.sent4: The reticles in the microscope created a web of precision for the scientist.
meanings.sent5: Through the reticles of the microscope, the student observed the intricate details of the cell.
